alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton; Montgomery; Preble; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 1:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN, NORTH CENTRAL HAMILTON, SOUTHEASTERN PREBLE, BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN WARREN AND SOUTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 157 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ross, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Oxford, Miamisburg, Forest Park, Springboro, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, Carlisle, South Middletown, Ross, Camden, Gratis, Seven Mile, Taylor Creek, Williamsdale, Hunter and Dry Ridge. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 29 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
